item.title: BUGS to PyMC
item.description: Redoing an older Bayesian Statistics course with more modern tools I’m working on translating the examples from Professor Vidakovic’s Bayesian Statistics course at Georgia Tech from MATLAB and OpenBUGS to Python (using libraries PyMC3 and pgmpy). As a former student and current TA, by far the number one complaint I’ve heard about the course is that OpenBUGS is outdated and a waste of time to learn. I chose PyMC because among the newer Probabilistic Programming Languages it seems the easiest to learn, especially since I’m most familiar with Python.

item.title: Group essays in small classes
item.description: One of my favorite exercises for small classes of intermediate students is the group essay. When I first started teaching, we would always write individual essays, as called for in the provided lesson plan. But that resulted in long periods of quiet, which isnâ€™t great for an oral English class. So I asked the students to take turns coming up with a sentence while I transcribed them. The result is usually a much more engaged class.
I’m Aaron Reding. Right now I live in Hainan, China, where I’m trying to be less bad at Chinese and surfing. I’m about to graduate with a master’s in analytics through Georgia Tech’s OMSA program.
